alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 4:08AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ST. TAMMANY, SOUTHEASTERN LIVINGSTON AND SOUTHERN TANGIPAHOA PARISHES THROUGH 445 AM CST... At 408 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whitehall, or 16 miles southwest of Hammond, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Ponchatoula, Albany, Springfield, Robert, Whitehall, Natalbany, and Killian. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 28 and 53. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 18 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany
